creator: dev@tomcat.apache.org
text:
To make tomcat.sh work in the System V style start/stop script environment, it needs to handle the arguments "start_msg" and "stop_msg" something like this:

if [ "$1" = "start_msg" ]; then
  shift
  echo "Starting Tomcat Servlet Engine"

elif [ "$1" = "stop_msg" ]; then
  shift
  echo "Stopping Tomcat Servlet Engine"

elif [ "$1" = "start" ] ; then
  shift
  echo Using classpath: ${CLASSPATH}

Otherwise, tomcat.sh will see these as invalid arguments and abort. HP/UX's init program passes these arguments to its rc scripts automatically.
